intro: Clinopodium elegans, commonly known as slender woodruff, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its fragrant, small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its aromatic qualities. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Clinopodium elegans is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported calming properties.
